research_session.research_goal: Develop novel gene therapies for inherited diseases

hypotheses.title: CRISPR-Cas9 Base Editing for Sickle Cell Disease
hypotheses.content: Base editing using CRISPR-Cas9 can precisely correct the Aâ†’T mutation in the HBB gene (Glu6Val) that causes sickle cell disease, restoring normal hemoglobin function without creating double-strand breaks
references: Frangoul et al. (2021) - CTX001 clinical trial results
Anzalone et al. (2019) - Prime editing methodology

hypotheses.title: AAV-Mediated Gene Replacement for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
hypotheses.content: Adeno-associated virus (AAV) vectors can deliver micro-dystrophin genes to muscle cells, providing functional dystrophin protein expression and improving muscle function in Duchenne muscular dystrophy patients
references: Mendell et al. (2020) - Systemic gene therapy trial

hypotheses.title: Lentiviral Gene Therapy for X-linked Severe Combined Immunodeficiency
hypotheses.content: Self-inactivating lentiviral vectors can safely deliver functional IL2RG genes to hematopoietic stem cells, restoring T-cell and NK-cell function in X-SCID patients without causing insertional mutagenesis
references: Mamcarz et al. (2019) - Lentiviral gene therapy trial
